person.persName: Zachariah Madison Sherley (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, civilian steamboat captain and boat store keeper)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, steamboat captain and boat store keeper. Louisa County, Virginia, native. Married to Nanine Taylor Sherley in Jefferson County on September 8, 1835. Father of John C. Sherley, Lewis Sherley, Thomas H. Sherley, Benjamin J. Sherley. Married to Susan W. Cromwell Sherley in Fayette County on February 14, 1856. Father of George W. Sherley. Steam boat furnisher in Louisville in 1860. Partner in Louisville & Cincinnati United States Mail Line in Louisville in 1862. Partner with Richard H. Woolfolk and Lewis A. Sherley in Sherley, Woolfolk, & Co. in Louisville in 1865. Served as president of the board of directors of the Louisville and Jeffersonville Ferry Co. in Louisville. Founder of Citizens National Bank in Louisville. Trustee for the medical college at the University of Louisville in Louisville. Member of the board of trustees of the Kentucky Institute for the Blind in Louisville. Trustee of Cave Hill Cemetery in Louisville.
